summary: Medina, officially called Al-Madinah al-Munawwarah, is a very important city in Islam and the capital of Medina Province in Saudi Arabia. It's the fourth largest city in the country with about 1.4 million people. The city is known as the "cradle of Islamic culture and civilization" and is home to the Prophet's Mosque, where Muhammad is buried. It's one of the three holiest cities in Islam. Before Islam, it was called Yathrib. Medina has been ruled by many different groups over its long history, including the Ottomans, the Saudis, and others. Today, many people visit Medina for religious reasons and to see its historic mosques.
title: Medina
